intro: Vincetoxicum pubens, commonly known as the velvet leaf or false bindweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruit is a follicle that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Vincetoxicum pubens is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, where it can form dense stands.
